Fields.DialogueText: You look like you have something on your mind.
What did you think of that last battle?

Fields.MenuText: It was long and arduous!
It was too easy. Call me the professor of naval battles.
I'm indifferent. A job is a job.

Fields.DialogueText: I have a feeling that it was.
Are you sure? Some of the rumors from the other Kami of the fleet might say otherwise.
Jobs are important and it's good to be the best at your job.
Why are you asking me about the battle? After all, you were there.
I'm just busy in thought... I am a squadron leader and I owe it to my younger sisters and the great Empire of Japan. I want to write a book!

Fields.MenuText: About Morganas?
About Belles?
About tuna?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, they will be involved in some of the chapters.
They'll be involved in some of the chapters, but the focus won't be exclusively on them.
YUCK! Why would I ever do that to myself? Does it look like I enjoy pain?
The book is about naval tactics. I need to go all over the world to collect data on previous naval battles to properly teach my kohai.
*ALARM*
Here comes a battle right now!
Quick! Get something to write with! We need to document this battle.
@BATTLE
Did we get down all that information from our last battle?

Fields.MenuText: Hmmm... this pad of paper got a bit wet during the battle.
The battle went by too fast for me to write it all down.
The rocking of the ship made it too hard to write.

Fields.DialogueText: WHY DID YOU LET THAT PAPER GET WET?!
Learn to write faster!
Why is it so hard to write?!
This is frustrating! I need a better solution to documenting battles for my book. Pen and paper seems too slow, and it is at risk for getting wet on a ship's deck.
Can't we just recall the battle later when we write it down?
And miss a detail of the battle?! I think not! I'm going to see what's out there for documenting this critical part of history.
As in technology?
Yes, the world is changing so much. Ships are noted for being vectors of the latest technology. Marconi sent the first wireless transmission on a ship.
How do you know this? Have you been studying?
Hey! Don't go insinuating that I'm a bookworm!
*ALARM*
If you think I'm a bookworm, I'll show you what I can do for this battle.
@BATTLE
Officer, is Tenryū in there? I haven't seen her lately...
Don't go in there, Captain! Tenryū is trying out some technology...
What's that supposed to mean?
Don't say that I didn't warn you, Captain....
(sheets of paper flying everywhere)
ARG! This thing, work!!!
What's going on in here?
I'm trying to use this typewriter!
Goodness, that's a lot of keys on that machine!
And it's in Kanji too, can you believe this?!? Who ever thought this was a good idea. Now where is that word...
*SNAP*
AAARRRGG!! The keys keep jamming!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure something better is out there. Don't get upset over this...
This machine is better off used as a boat anchor.
Practice makes perfect!

Fields.DialogueText: Well that ship has sailed!
Hai! At least it will be easy to use.
UURRRGG!! I'm not going to be defeated by some machine!
That's it! I'm chucking this thing overboard! Who ever thought this was a good idea?!
But it was her idea...
I HEARD THAT! I can do more than just see in all directions!
*ALARM*
There's a better use! I'm going to throw this typewriter at the enemy!
@BATTLE
Look at this, Captain!
I could see it if you would stop waiving it around for a second!
Fine, fine. Here, take a look.
What's this machine for? Magnetophon?
It's a machine that records things.
Like a dictation machine?
I think it's better, because it records sounds onto cellulose acetate coated in some sort of oxide instead of wire in the dictation machine.

Fields.MenuText: Let me guess, we must go somewhere to get it?
Is this book honestly worth the effort?
How long is this book going to be?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! This is state of the art technology!
There's no question about it! We need to document this information for future generations.
How long was that book War and Peace? 1200 pages? I will write no less than double that amount!
I'm not going to stand in the way of your ambition.
I'm shocked! You learn fast.
*ALARM*
URG! Those Morganas make me VERY UPSET!
I wish I could avoid your temper...
WHAT DID YOU SAY?!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, look how impressive it is!
Is this the Magnetophon?
Hai! Made by the German company AEG!
How does it work?
You put one reel on that side, and then thread this thing, called the tape to the other side. Start the reel moving and you record into this microphone here.
Wonderful! Let's see it in action!
These controls... URGH! I'll do it later!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe have an officer read the instructions?
Let me have a look...
Is the recording switch on?

Fields.DialogueText: And have the officers think I am incapable? Try again, I'd rather eat tuna!
I'll read the instructions first!
Where is the recording switch? These instructions are in German! I need to find a crew member who can translate them.
*ALARM*
NOT AGAIN! Captain, get that pad of paper ready, write things down quickly!
@BATTLE
I think I understand how this Magnetophon machine works now!
Let's try it out!
Not so fast! I'm going to wait until a battle comes to test it out!
I'd imagine that shouldn't take too long.
Hai, here comes a group of Morganas, look! Let's set everything up and be ready to flip on the record switch!
@BATTLE
HAHA! I've done it! Flip the recording switch off!
Yes, Miss Tenryū.
Bring the Magnetophon back to my office. I want to hook it up to the speakers and hear what the tape could capture.

Fields.MenuText: This sounds exciting!
Are you sure you trust the crew?
I have a bad feeling about this...

Fields.DialogueText: I can't wait to hear what noises it captured!
I trust my crew with my life! You're the captain, so you're the one in charge.
Do you think the Magnetophon didn't record the battle?
NOOOOOO!!
*SMASH*
Watch out!
What's going on in here?!
DUCK!
*CRASH*
What's the meaning of this?
IT DIDN'T RECORD!
I thought you read the instructions?
I DID! ARG! Let me clarify this... It DID record. However, the young and inexperienced crew member here accidently recorded over the battle.
How did that happen?
I switched the reel back to the other side to try and rewind the tape... but accidently hit record instead of just the play switch...
THERE! A CONFESSION!!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think it's a confession if the person has already admitted to making a mistake. That's not how confessions work.
I'll smoke that crew member, so don't worry about them!
It's only a tape, so let's try it again.

Fields.DialogueText: Whose side are you on anyway? I need to write my book! I can't let my greatest achievements get lost in time!
Good!
Technology is advertised as making life easier. So far it has caused me nothing but pain.
*ALARM*
See? Here's another chance to try out the recording again!
THIS ISN'T HELPING!
@BATTLE
RUN!
HAHA! I have the tape! Let's go listen to it in the Magnetophon in my office!
Don't forget to rewind it first.
I'd rather listen to it backwards than risk recording over this audio.
Here we go. Let's listen to it.
Hmph!
What's wrong? Sounds like it got audio of the battle.
Yeah, but what part is what? Now I must remember what happened when listening to the reel play, and it just sounds like a bunch of background noise!
Then you're not happy?
It's supposed to make my life easier! EASIER! It's given me nothing but frustration!

Fields.MenuText: Just walk away and come back to it later!
I'm sure this machine will make your life easier, somehow.
Let's go eat some zazamushi.

Fields.DialogueText: URG! I'm so upset! I don't want to walk away... I want to cut it in half!
When you figure out how it will do that, let me know.
The galley has zazamushi again?
You've convinced me, Kanchou. I am walking away... I'll come back to it after I've eaten some crunchy, savory zazamushi.
*ALARM*
UURRRGGGH!!
AHH!! Your face! Breathe!
@BATTLE
I can't believe the galley only had four kilograms of zazamush! Are they insinuating that I'm fat?!
It's not the most popular dish with the crew...
Four kilograms, FOUR! At best that's a light snack!
How can you eat that much and not gain weight?
What do you mean?
You're very svelte. How can you eat that much and not gain any weight?
You really think so?
Oh... Yes, I confess, you are very beautiful.
Oh, Kanchou! You're making me blush like a schoolgirl.
Wait a minute... you confess? You lectured me earlier on how confessions work. I'm upset!

Fields.MenuText: AHH, sorry!
Oh, no!
No, this is an actual confession!

Fields.DialogueText: ARRGGGG, I'll make you wish you were sorry!
Oh, yes! If you're scared, you should have thought twice about telling me what I know and don't know!
Don't tell me what I know and don't know!!
*ALARM*
Safe...
AAAAAHHHH!!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, listen!
I SAID I WAS SORRY EARLIER!
What on Earth are you talking about? Are you trying to tell me what I don't know again???
SORRY!!
Now, listen to this tape reel!
Oh... oh, sure!
Listen to it! Do you hear that!
I hear background noise, someone whistling...
This was a recording during battle. Do you know what this means?

Fields.MenuText: Some people like to whistle to calm themselves I guess?
Maybe it was recorded over the first tape reel?
That is mysterious...

Fields.DialogueText: During a battle??
I put in a brand new tape reel for that battle!
It just gives me goosebumps!
This can only mean one thing... there is a ghost on the ship!
A ghost?
What other explanation is there?
*ALARM*
Watch out! This battle also has a ghost attached to it!
@BATTLE
Did you see any ghosts during the battle?

Fields.MenuText: I don't believe in ghosts!
I think I caught a glimpse of something...
I didn't see anything.

Fields.DialogueText: You say that now, but you might think otherwise when you see one!
AHH!! This is giving me goosebumps.
Maybe it is playing tricks on us.
I might be one of the older ships in the fleet, but I don't feel old enough to get any ghosts hanging around me.
Well if you see one, try and capture it.
How do I do that? They can walk through walls... Do you think this tape recorder will work?
It might capture the sound of the spirit again.
Excellent idea! I will leave the tape recorder in various places to capture the voice of the spirit.
*ALARM*
There it is! Let's start recording in this ship to see if we can capture the voice of the spirit.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, listen to this! The Magnetophon picked something up!
*munching noises on the Magnetophon*
It sounds like someone eating.
Right! But all hands were on deck helping with the battle at that same. Who was in here eating?
Do ghosts get hungry?
Hai! This is the reason why you leave offerings at temples.

Fields.MenuText: Makes sense.
I still don't believe in this ghost nonsense.
Ghosts scare me!

Fields.DialogueText: It all seems to come together! I wonder what other ghosts have been caught on recordings.
What is it then? Until I hear a better explanation otherwise, I am going to blame it on a ghost.
Don't say that! It gives me goosebumps! I can't let my younger ships see a senior member of the fleet be scared!
What are you going to do if you catch a ghost?
I'm going to have a priest tell it to go away. I just need to find the right temple, something older and better to convince the spirit to latch onto that.
*ALARM*
I'm too young to have spirits walking around my ship!
@BATTLE
What are we doing here?
I'm trying to, uh, prepare something special. For someone special.
That sounds elaborate. Need any help?
Pass me that seasoning. This meal needs to be perfect.
Making catfish? That's going to smell great when you start frying it.
Don't watch me so closely! In fact, why not just... uh... dance around the mess decks a bit and make sure evil spirits don't make me mess up.
What? You want me to-
Kanchou! Just... please...

Fields.MenuText: Fine, fine. I'll just... dance around and chase off evil spirits while you cook.
I don't believe in evil spirits.
Catfish is one of my favorite meals. Is this for me?

Fields.DialogueText: Perfect! I appreciate your helpfulness, Kanchou.
Would you believe that I'll cry if this catfish isn't perfect? I can't mess up this recipe!
Wait. Forget I said that. What?! *blush* NO! Of course it isn't. It's, um...
*ALARM*
Arrghh! I can't tell if this battle is a welcome distraction or a frustration right now!
@BATTLE
That's why it needs to be perfect. I want to impress you and make you fall in-
Just follow me to the bridge. Let's go, Tenryū.
It will be worth it when I surprise you with this delicious meal! You'll enjoy it so much, you'll fall in love with-
It has to impress you so that you'll look at me, and realize how much you love-
Um... wait. Forget I said that!
Tenryū, what's wrong? You look scared!
No matter what I do, that ghost is still on the ship!

Fields.MenuText: If it's a ghost, there's nothing we can do.
This ghost must be really powerful.
Maybe it isn't a ghost?

Fields.DialogueText: Right! Maybe we need a Shinto priest, you think?
AHHH! Don't tell me that! what are we going to do?!
You mean it's a demon? Or some other kind of spirit?
There's something causing this commotion, be it ghost or otherwise. Take that Magnetophon and set it up in your office, then hide in the closet.
Right! Then I can jump out and stab the ghost!
Stab a ghost. Right. Sure...
Let's plot a course for Japan. In case I can't catch this spirit, I have a fallback plan.
*ALARM*
NOT AGAIN! I'm trying to deal with something supernatural!
But the Morganas are sort of supernatural...
I KNOW WHAT THEY ARE!
@BATTLE
You better go see Miss Tenryū. She's caught the ghost, and as you can guess... she's not too happy about it.
You mean she CAUGHT a ghost?
Go see for yourself, but watch out though.
Oh right, the ghost.
Well, I was referencing her temper...
Her outbursts have been pretty wild lately. Any idea what's going on with her? I can't believe it's just this "ghost" business.
*snort* Really? You have no idea what she's thinking about all the time?

Fields.MenuText: What's that supposed to mean?
Oh. It's that obvious, huh.
Well, if it helps, I like Tenryū, too.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Captain. I must have swalled a bug.
She talks about you all the time, Captain.
That's a relief. I can't fathom seeing her with a broken heart. Nobody will survive that!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I heard you shouting, Tenryū! Where's that ghost?
It's NOT a ghost!
A demon, then? Did you slay it? I knew they couldn't stand your fury!
It was THIS! This all along! A dirty ship rat!
A rat? Ugh.
Yup! A rat got on the Magnetophon deck and was eating food.
What about the whistling?
It also recorded a crew member cleaning my office. URG, I'M SO ANGRY RIGHT NOW!
I hope I'm safe from you at this range.
Oh, sweet Captain, I'd never hurt you... but I REALLY wanted to chop that ghost in half! It turned out to be a dumb rat!! OOF!

Fields.MenuText: You're so cute when you're angry.
You are a very passionate woman.
I'm just happy it wasn't a ghost.

Fields.DialogueText: Aww! Thanks... but you're trivializing my anger!!!
I am... and I'm passionate about fighting off a strong enemy, too!
How those rumors even got started is just... infuriating!
You're not embarrassed for mistaking that rat for a ghost?
I'm going to make you feel embarrassed if you don't stop getting on my nerves!
*ALARM*
AARRRGGGH!!
@BATTLE
Or rats.
Back to my book. I need to figure out how to write this. I don't even know where to begin.
Start at the beginning, and when you get to the end, stop.
I found it funny.
Well, here's my plan. I am going start writing out my battle tactics. Once I've written out all of them, I'll decide how to organize the book.
Are you going to write all your plans out by hand?
I'm never touching a typewriter again, unless it's to destroy it!

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like we'll need a lot of paper.
Maybe write a love story?
I don't read much... but maybe if it's a strategy book I could consider it training for my job.

Fields.DialogueText: Better stock up!
Why? I need the respect of my kohai. I am a senior Kami of the Fleet!
I'm not just writing this book exclusively for you. It's for the posterity of the great Empire of Japan!

Fields.MenuText: Eh... Writing a book sounds exhausting.
Sounds exciting!

Fields.DialogueText: Only if you have no plan. I, for one, have a great plan!
I thought so, too!
You could help... if you had some free time to spend with me.
I need more ink. Hmm... Here, Kanchou, hold this!
You've made this place a mess, Tenryū. Papers are flying everywhere!
And don't let them fly away. I have the battle information organized chronologically, so they need to stay with the battle their belong with.
How may pages have you written so far?
Ten.
Out of?
At least two hundred.

Fields.MenuText: You're off to a good start!
Such a long way to go!
Impressive! I don't know that I could tackle a writing project that big.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! It will be all written down in no time!
I don't need to hear the negative. Not now.
As a Kami of the Fleet, I don't expect a mortal to be able to keep up.
Do Kami of the Fleet ever consider dating?
Dating is a great idea. Recording the dates would help keep my notes in chronological order. Like using a calendar.
Not exactly what I was talking about...
*ALARM*
Time for battle! Don't let me forget about that "dating" thing so I can write it down later!
@BATTLE
Dating? Sure!
Great! I'm glad to hear that you're so receptive to the idea of us-
Sigh...
Pens, I need more pens!
More pens, already?
Pens are much weaker than a sword, but they cause my wrist more pain! See? Look at this pen! The tip just breaks!
How many pens have you gone through?
I lost count after twenty...

Fields.MenuText: I'll just order a box of industrial strength pens.
Why are you breaking them so quickly?
What if you went through swords that quickly?

Fields.DialogueText: Make that two boxes! Breaking pens makes me so upset!
When I know exactly what to write, the pen can't keep up with my hand. Clearly, these are inferior pens!
Then I would bash the maker on the head with their inferior quality sword.
More pens it is!
Make sure the quality is good! Take this broken one for reference.
*ALARM*
Here, lets throw these inferior pens at the Morganas!
@BATTLE
Maybe afterwards we could find some time for a quiet night together?
What was that? Sorry, Kanchou, no time to talk! Let's fight!
Bring me more paper!
Again?
I'm running out!
What about the pens?
I am doing well on pens, for the time being.

Fields.MenuText: How many pages have you written so far?
What about additional paper for other drafts or copies of the book?
How are you writing the book so fast?

Fields.DialogueText: Nearly two hundred, Kanchou.
Hai, bring me all that! More paper!
One my momentum starts, it cannot be stopped!
Oh, give me more ink, too, I'm running low on ink again!
That's so much ink.
What's wrong with lots of ink?!
*ALARM*
URG! These Morganas are going to break my train of thought!
@BATTLE
Nothing. Say, maybe we could talk about your book over a nice dinner?
Tenryū, help!
What happened this time?
There are papers all over the deck. I can hardly get through this compartment.
Don't move them! I think I have the battle stories in order.
But what if I must move past these pages? I have places to be.
Just fly over them, but don't let the downdraft scatter the pages.

Fields.MenuText: Moving through here in a hurry would be a disaster.
Have you ever considered paperweights?
You know I can't fly, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I can move with such agility that the wind is not even disturbed.
What, those typewriter machines? I vowed never to touch one again!
You know, I wish I had a paper weight, so I could throw it at you right about now.
*stack of papers collapses...*
AHH, MY PAGES!!
*ALARM*
I need to go!
@BATTLE
This isn't helping your chances of getting a date with me!
HAHA! AHHAHAHA!
Help! Miss Tenryū has gone crazy!
What happened? What did you do to make her upset?
Oh, listen to the sound of this sentence... Isn't it beautiful? This book is truly a masterpiece in the making!
What are you doing, Tenryū?
I am editing my rough draft! This pen cuts through grammatical errors like my sword cuts through the hearts of my enemies!

Fields.MenuText: What's gotten into you?
I thought your pens broke like cheap swords.
Don't cut anyone with a pen. That sounds painful!

Fields.DialogueText: The drive to finish my book!
URG! Why did you buy me cheap pens? I said industrial grade!
Not with these cheap pens! I'm nearly out of two boxes that were ordered!
*ALARM*
NOT AGAIN!
Watch out, she's throwing pens!
@BATTLE
What's was that noise coming from your cabin?
The sound of my book being typed up!
So... you finally decided that the typewriter I got for you might not be such a bad idea.
Hai, and I appreciate your gift, Kanchou. It did make my writing go much faster.
Glad it helped.
More importantly, though, I like it because it was a gift from you.

Fields.MenuText: You're welcome.
I want to make you happy.
I just wanted you to get your writing done. It was driving the whole ship crazy.

Fields.DialogueText: Does this mean I have to get you a gift now? Hrm... I'll worry about that later.
You succeeded!
Very funny, Kanchou. I know you don't mean that.
It even makes a great sound when I type really fast, like... like rain on a tin roof!
When you're book is done, let me know. We'll have to celebrate with a drink.
I could use a drink. I'm still so-
*ALARM*
Oh! Time to fight, but take this before I forget!
Whoa! It's done? This is a copy of your book?
Hai, the first full draft, hot off the presses! Read it and tell me what you think!
@BATTLE
Have you finished reading the book yet, Kanchou?
Not yet!
Is it good from what you've read?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, um... Yes, yes. The, uh, elements are all there. A beginning, middle and an end...
There are, um, many battles to read about.
Why am I not in the book? Do I show up near the end?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? It's not really a linear story.
Hai. I am hoping that my kohai learn from my experience.
Oh... um... I was saving that for the second book!
*ALARM*
Don't let that battle stop you! Finish the book!
@BATTLE
Have you finished the book yet?

Fields.MenuText: I've read some, but I didn't finish.
Yes.
It got damaged during battle before I could finish it.

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? Finish the book! I've already given out other copies to the crew members.
From what you read... what did you think about it? What was your favorite part? Do you think my kohai will like it?
No, NO, NOO!! This can't be! I'll get you another copy right away.
Let's see... What was my favorite part? Probably that compelling battle description. The one on the open water?
Excellent! I was wondering what you thought about it. It's a bit different than battling in the Yangtze River.
I don't know what this feeling is, excitement? Let me know what you think about the book when you finish reading it. A second time.
Wonderful!
Well... from what I've seen so far...
A second read?
Once you're done, we can talk about it over a nice meal together. What do you say?
Time for me to get started! I suddenly feel like reading...
Ha ha ha! I thought you might.

Fields.MenuText: Was this something you've been looking forward to as much as I have?
This is just what I wanted.

Fields.DialogueText: Me, too.
Besides, we have something to celebrate! You finally finished your book.
Kanchou! I didn't realize how much you liked my book!
That's not all I like.
This is where I blush again! You know what, Kanchou? I'm all out of words from my writing, so...
*kiss*
Is that the begining of the story or the end?
*ALARM*
Find out after the fight, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
I thought you were going to have the cooks make something on the mess deck for us, but this is much nicer.
More intimate this way, right? I thought we needed some time for just the two of us.

Fields.MenuText: You're right. It seems like we haven't had any time for ourselves.

Fields.DialogueText: *blush* It is.
We work hard, and we deserve it.
And what did you think of it?

Fields.MenuText: For a first book, it's impressive!
You should let me edit your book before you publish it.
It's just what I expected. An insightful study of naval combat that future generations should be grateful to study!

Fields.DialogueText: Wow...
And I'll only get better from here!
I'd appreciate any help you can offer to make it better.
I like your optimism. Also...
That's a really mature attitude to have. I like that about you, and...
